page.title: 05CUSTOMS
page.content:
Some annual customs concerned with farming and the protection of livestock revolve around the extermination of vermin. In winter, there is fox-hunting, on foot, with guns and Jack Russell terriers;in spring, there is crow-shooting whilst the corpses of moles which have been trapped or poisoned can be seen hanging on fences at any time of year.
For hundreds of years, in times of national importance, beacons have been lit on the top of Beacon Fell, so giving the hill its name. A beacon was lit most recently in 1977 to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.It was one of a chain of beacons which stretched the length and breadth of the country.
